ÜBER UNS
========

NIETZER® . Rechtsanwälte . Attorneys at Law (USA ) ist als Wirtschaftskanzlei auf Unternehmensrecht (Deutschland und USA) spezialisiert. Die seit 1924 und somit seit über 100 Jahren bestehende Nietzer'sche Anwaltstradition wird seit 1994 in dritter Generation fortgeführt. Kerngebiete sind die Beratung bei nationalen und internationalen Unternehmenstransaktionen, das Handels- und Gesellschaftsrecht, das Vertriebsrecht, das Vertragsrecht (auch in den Bereichen Forschung, Entwicklung, Joint Ventures, gewerblicher Rechtsschutz und IT), das Arbeits- und Datenschutzrecht sowie Compliance. In diesen Bereichen bieten wir auch Seminare und Mitarbeiterschulungen an.

Internationales und nationales Wirtschafts- Vertrags- und Gesellschaftsrecht sind heutzutage für jedes Unternehmen nicht mehr wegdenkbare Begleiter im täglichen Geschäft. Die internationale Dominanz des angelsächsischen Rechtssystems (insbesondere des USA-Rechts) und darauf basierender US-Vertragsstrukturen macht es unabdingbar, nicht nur Kenntnisse im nationalen Unternehmensrecht zu haben, sondern auch im US-Recht, insbesondere US-amerikanischen Unternehmensrecht, US-Vertragsrecht sowie US-amerikanischen Gesellschaftsrecht.

Wir handeln für Mandanten als Treuhänder, Interims-Geschäftsführer, Vertreter in Aufsichtsgremien (auch USA) und Testamentsvollstrecker. Wir legen höchsten Wert auf Effizienz, Erreichbarkeit, Augenmaß und Erfolgsorientierung. Wir geben pragmatische Handlungsempfehlungen und setzen auf nachhaltige und vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit – fachlich wie menschlich. Unter unseren Kunden finden sich deutsche und ausländische Konzerngesellschaften, Familienunternehmen, Beteiligungsgesellschaften und Startups.

Markdown Content:
Welcome to TIKIR FENDO
----------------------

The regionally and internationally active law firm TIKIR FENDO was founded in 2022 through the merger of the law firm FENDO, founded since 1999 in the heart of the state capital Stuttgart by attorney Altar Fendo, and the law firm TIKIR, founded since 2006 by attorney Pinar Tikir-Fendo in Heilbronn, Baden-Württemberg. Through the merger of two internationally active law firms with many years of professional experience, the law firm TIKIR FENDO bundles its competences and is thus even better able to provide its clients with the best possible legal advice and to protect their interests in a trustworthy manner.

As an internationally active law firm, TIKIR FENDO cooperates with highly qualified advisor colleagues from Germany and abroad, thus guaranteeing its clients first-class, fast and efficient services. In cross-border transactions, proficiency in foreign languages is a fundamental requirement. In this respect, TIKIR FENDO Law Office meets the highest standards in both negotiation and documentation.

The main practice areas of TIKIR FENDO Law Office are criminal law and family law. Lawyer Pinar Tikir-Fendo and lawyer Altar Fendo have special additional qualifications in criminal law due to their theoretical and many years of practical experience, which is why they have been awarded the title "Specialist Lawyer for Criminal Law" and "Specialist Lawyer for Criminal Law" respectively by the Stuttgart Bar Association.

In addition, Ms. Pinar Tikir-Fendo has been serving her clients in the field of family law since 2006 and, as an experienced specialist lawyer for family law, is working for her clients nationwide in a trustworthy manner.

TIKIR FENDO also advises her clients in the areas of labor law, commercial and corporate law, family and inheritance law as well as tenancy and property law.

‍

[More about us →](https://www.kanzlei-fendo.de/en/team.html)

Heil­bronn
==========

The city cent­re of Heil­bronn is cha­rac­te­ri­sed by its his­to­ric buil­dings –- abo­ve all the Kilian’s Church and the town hall with its magni­fi­cent astro­no­mic­al clock. Not far away is our office in Heil­bronn. In our offices we offer you the full ran­ge of ser­vices of the law firm in a well-main­tai­ned atmo­sphe­re ([BSKP Ser­vices Fol­der [PDF]](https://bskp.de/app/uploads/2020/03/BSKP-Broschuere-engl-Web.pdf)). In doing so, we rely on clo­se coope­ra­ti­on with col­le­agues from other BSKP loca­ti­ons and exter­nal part­ners. In order to gua­ran­tee you the best ser­vice, our experts regu­lar­ly under­go fur­ther trai­ning and work clo­se­ly tog­e­ther not only in their teams, but also across disciplines.

This is how we pro­vi­de you with the indi­vi­du­al solu­ti­on you need– quick­ly, relia­bly and with foresight.

Frank Gerhard was born in 1973 in Hagen, Westphalia. After graduating from high school and training as a bank clerk, he studied law at the Universities of Giessen and Bonn. He passed his first state examination in 2001, specialising in commercial and corporate law. He completed his legal clerkship at the District Court of Bochum in 2003, with internships at the Chamber of Industry and Commerce in Essen and at a well-known commercial law firm in London. Since 2003, he has worked in law firms specialising in commercial law and joined RBB & Partner in 2013. He has been a specialist in commercial and corporate law since 2015 and in banking and capital markets law since February 2017.

About Commercial Litigation Law in Heilbronn, Germany
-----------------------------------------------------

Commercial litigation is a branch of civil law that deals with resolving disputes arising from business and commercial relationships. In Heilbronn, Germany, commercial litigation typically involves conflicts between businesses, such as breach of contract, payment disputes, partnership disagreements, competition issues, and shareholder conflicts. The region follows German federal law while also adhering to specific regulations and procedures set by the local courts in Baden-Wuerttemberg.

Heilbronn's status as a thriving industrial and commercial hub means that commercial litigation is a significant area of legal practice. Courts in the area are well-versed in dealing with complex matters related to trade, company law, and financial disputes. Understanding the local legal landscape and procedures is crucial for achieving favorable outcomes in commercial litigation cases.

Why You May Need a Lawyer
-------------------------

There are many situations where hiring a lawyer with expertise in commercial litigation in Heilbronn can be essential. Here are some common scenarios:

*   Your business is being sued by another company or individual.
*   You need to enforce a contract or claim outstanding payments from clients or suppliers.
*   You are facing partnership or shareholder disputes within your company.
*   A business agreement or transaction has gone wrong, leading to financial loss or contractual issues.
*   You are involved in disputes over intellectual property, trademarks, or unfair competition.
*   Your company is accused of breaching regulations or is being investigated by authorities.
*   You need to protect your business reputation or seek compensation for damages.

Engaging a qualified commercial litigation lawyer can help ensure your rights are protected, provide strategic legal advice, and represent your interests effectively in court or out-of-court negotiations.

Local Laws Overview
-------------------

In Heilbronn, and throughout Germany, commercial litigation is primarily governed by the German Civil Code (Buergerliches Gesetzbuch - BGB), the German Commercial Code (Handelsgesetzbuch - HGB), and the Code of Civil Procedure (Zivilprozessordnung - ZPO). Local courts (Amtsgericht and Landgericht Heilbronn) have jurisdiction over most commercial disputes within their regional boundaries.

Key aspects of local laws relevant to commercial litigation include:

*   Strict deadlines for filing lawsuits, often ranging from three to ten years depending on the type of claim.
*   Mandatory attempts at settlement or mediation in some cases before proceeding to court.
*   Obligation to provide all relevant documents and evidence (disclosure is not as broad as in some common law jurisdictions).
*   Court procedures are formal and typically written, with oral hearings scheduled as needed.
*   Loser pays principle applies, meaning the losing party may have to cover the winning party's legal costs.
*   Specialized commercial chambers in local courts handle business disputes quickly and efficiently.

Understanding both federal and local regulations is vital, as procedures and interpretation can vary depending on the nature and complexity of the dispute.

Frequently Asked Questions
--------------------------

### What types of disputes are handled in commercial litigation?

Commercial litigation covers disputes between businesses, such as contract breaches, unpaid invoices, company ownership conflicts, intellectual property issues, and partnership disagreements.

### How long does a commercial litigation case usually take in Heilbronn?

The duration varies based on complexity and court workload. Simple cases may be resolved in months, while complex disputes can take several years.

### Is it mandatory to hire a lawyer for commercial cases?

For cases before the Landgericht and higher courts, professional legal representation is mandatory. Even when not required, hiring a lawyer greatly increases your chances of success.

### What are the typical costs involved in commercial litigation?

Costs include court fees, legal representation, and expert witness fees if necessary. The losing party generally pays the legal costs of both sides, subject to court determination.

### Can I settle a dispute without going to court?

Yes. Out-of-court settlements and mediation are common and often encouraged to save time and costs for all parties involved.

### Which court in Heilbronn will handle my case?

Most commercial disputes start at either the Amtsgericht (local court) or Landgericht (regional court), depending on the amount in dispute and the nature of the case.

### What is evidence disclosure like in German commercial litigation?

The process is more limited than in some other countries. Parties submit only the evidence supporting their claim or defense rather than a full disclosure.

### Are international disputes heard in Heilbronn courts?

Yes, local courts may hear international commercial disputes if the case has a sufficient connection to Heilbronn or German law applies as per the contract.

### How do I enforce a court judgment?

Once a final judgment is issued, enforcement mechanisms such as garnishment of accounts or seizing assets may be applied through the local bailiff (Gerichtsvollzieher).

### What happens if I lose the case?

If you lose, you may be ordered to pay the other party’s legal costs, and the judgment will be enforceable against you. Appeals are possible but must be filed within strict deadlines.

Additional Resources
--------------------

For individuals and businesses seeking more information or assistance, the following resources are recommended:

*   Heilbronn Bar Association (Rechtsanwaltskammer Stuttgart): Provides lawyer directories and information on finding legal representation.
*   Local Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Industrie- und Handelskammer Heilbronn-Franken): Offers support and resources for business-related legal matters.
*   State Courts of Baden-Wuerttemberg: The website provides general court information and resources for litigants.
*   German Federal Ministry of Justice: Holds comprehensive guides about civil and commercial law in Germany.
*   Court-based mediation centers and commercial dispute resolution services in the Heilbronn area.

Next Steps
----------

If you are facing a potential commercial dispute or have received a summons, act quickly to protect your interests. Start by gathering all relevant documents and correspondence related to your case. Contact a qualified commercial litigation lawyer in Heilbronn as soon as possible for an initial consultation. Most lawyers offer a first meeting to assess your case and advise on possible strategies.

During your initial meeting, be prepared to describe your situation in detail, provide all supporting documents, and discuss your desired outcome. Your lawyer will guide you through the legal process, help you understand your rights and obligations, and represent you throughout the dispute resolution process, whether in negotiations or in court.

Do not delay seeking professional legal advice, as missed deadlines and procedural mistakes can harm your case. Prompt action gives you the best opportunity to resolve your commercial litigation matter successfully in Heilbronn, Germany.

Most firms on our platform speak English and are experienced in both local and international legal matters. ### Lawyer Tobias Vels

##### Specialised in commercial and corporate law

 Specialised in construction and architectural law

 Lecturer at the heilbronn university of applied sciences

Tobias Vels was born in Bonn in 1977, grew up partly abroad and completed his studies at the Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität of Bonn. He completed his studies in economics with an intermediate diploma, his law studies with a focus on corporate law, and his legal clerkship in the district of the Higher Regional Court of Cologne. During his studies and traineeship he worked for medium-sized and big law firms in Germany, Canada and Israel. In addition to his work as a lawyer at RBB & Partner, he was a founding partner of an engineering firm and, since its sale, has been managing director of a consulting firm specialising in mining . Mr Vels is married and father of two children and enjoys sports in his leisure. He is also involved in party politics and a service club.

Dr. Patrizia Antoni  Attorney
=============================

Dr. Patriza Antoni is a founding Partner of AHS Lawyers. Patrizia’s practice focuses on business and corporate law, employment law, tax law, contract law and litigation. Patrizia has been practicing law for 20 years. She is a certified specialist in tax law (Fachanwalt für Steuerrecht) and a certified specialist in employment law (Fachanwalt für Arbeitsrecht). She is fluent in English.

Patrizia has practiced both in the law firm environment and as an in-house counsel. She has represented companies throughout her career. Her focus has been on helping businesses do what they do best and making sure they don’t get sidetracked by legal issues.

Patrizia acts as a counsel to many private businesses and entrepreneurs on a day to day business, including drafting and negotiating contracts, collections, litigation. She has negotiated, prepared, and facilitated private mergers. Patrizia has prepared and negotiated lease agreements, loan documents, shareholder agreements, asset purchase agreements and others.

#### Consent to cookies and to the collection and disclosure of your user data to third parties

We place technically necessary cookies on our website, which ensure the basic functions of the website and are indispensable. We do not require consent for these cookies, so these cookies will be set even if you select "reject all" below. We use technically necessary cookies to provide our services and to store settings made by the user (such as the preferred language). In case of your consent, we also use other performance-enhancing cookies (statistics and usage measurement as well as external services). We use the cookies exclusively to be able to adapt and further develop our website according to your wishes. In the process, your personal data (IP address, user behavior, etc.) is processed and stored in order to achieve the above purposes. An identification of your person is not to be feared due to the pseudonymization of the data. You can find an explanation of the various cookies and data protection procedures under "make individual settings" or in our data protection information. Settings

Essential services and cookies

- [x]  

Technically necessary cookies (essential cookies) enable basic functions and are indispensable for the proper functioning of the homepage. They can be set without consent and therefore cannot be deselected.

DIRO Multisite Cookie

- [x]  

The DIRO Multisite cookie is used to store the settings you have made yourself on this website (e.g. the preferred language) as well as the content of external providers that you have approved. In doing so, under the DIRO_C_FINGERPRINT processing operation, the IDs of the services requiring consent that were present when you last accessed the page, as well as their configuration settings and assignment to categories in the privacy popup (as an encrypted string) are collected and stored. The sole purpose of this data processing is to store the settings made. The storage takes place for one year.

Google reCAPTCHA

- [x]  

We use the cookie NID of the computer program reCAPTCHA on our website, which is operated by Google LLC (1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA). The purpose of this is to distinguish whether an action on the Internet is performed by a human being or a computer program or bot. In this context, when you visit the website, your behavior (IP address, duration of visit, mouse movements, etc.) is recorded, pseudonymized and forwarded to Google. The storage period is 6 months. The storage takes place on servers in the USA. For more information about the further use of the pseudonymized data by Google, please refer to the information available at https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=de.

Statistics and usage measurement

- [x]  

Statistics cookies are used by the website operator to understand how users interact with the website by collecting and reporting information anonymously.

Usage measurement with Matomo

- [x]  

We use the website analysis tool Matomo to analyze user behavior and the reach of our website. This sets the cookie "_pk_id". By using Matomo, 2 bytes of your IP address, the website accessed, the referrer website (website from which you reached the website accessed here), the subpages accessed from the website accessed, the time spent on the website and the frequency with which the website is accessed are determined and stored. This serves the sole purpose of obtaining anonymized statistical data on how you use the website. The storage period is 6 months in the case of the cookie pk_ref and 30 minutes in the case of the cookie _pk_ses.

External services

- [x]  

We also offer external services on our website. Here, content from video platforms, social media platforms or other external services is initially blocked by default. If cookies from external media are accepted, access to this content no longer requires individual manual consent.

Geographic maps from OpenStreetMaps

- [x]  

By integrating OpenStreetMaps on our website, we set the cookie "_osm_location". In doing so, your IP address is transmitted to the third-party server of OpenStreetMaps, whereby it learns that you have visited our site. The purpose of this integration is to display addresses on a map that is integrated into the website. The storage period is 1 year.

Interaktive Formulare der DIRO AG

- [x]  

Unverbindliches Textbeispiel: Für bestimmte Funktionen (z.B. Kündigungscheck) stellen wir Formulare der DIRO AG zur Verfügung, die von einem Server der DIRO AG geladen werden. Dabei werden u.U. personenbezogene Daten übermittelt.

Appointments with Calenso

- [x]  

We use the external service Calenso on our website. In the course of this, your e-mail address, other contact information, appointment content and data, as well as any additional data you provide in this context are collected and stored. This serves the sole purpose of making appointments and group appointments bookable online. For this purpose, Calenso provides a web application for booking appointments. The data is processed on servers in Switzerland. You provide your data for the duration of the contract with Calenso. For more details on the processing of data by Calenso, please refer to the information available at https://calenso.com/datenschutz.
